TopicTitle: Parts not loading when using one texture with multiple models

Articles.Content:
I have about 7 different parts that use the same texture, and I was trying to minimize the memory footprint by using a single texture file for all the models. I tried organizing it in a similar manner as the B9 parts, where there is one or two textures in a folder, and then multiple .mu files and their corresponding .cfg. The parts don't load at all. I don't even see an error message in the debug menu.

So my question then is is there a specific standard that needs to be followed in order for this to function, or a specific file type or cfg setup?
I do this for my FusTek Station Parts - basically, it's recommended that you put all the CFGs, models and the shared common textures in the same directory.
That's exactly what I said. Textures, models and cfgs all in the same directory.

Could you please post the following?:

 - The directory structure, containing the filenames of all the model, texture and CFG files

 - The contents of each CFG file (for each file, copy and paste their contents and wrap them around 

     tags)

It's possible that you may have broken filename references.
NVM. I think I figured it out. no .mu at the end of the file path and for whatever reason it didn't like my 0.2.0 in the file path either.
Yeah, that's probably the culprit. I found that one out the hard way too when I started minimizing my local memory footprint.
